intro: Sophora raivavaeensis, commonly known as the Raivavae Sophora, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Raivavae in French Polynesia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and delicate, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect this botanical rarity.
